history.text: Hey!
you were going to tell me about a movie
Hello there, great to meet you.  Im here today to tell you about the movie The Wolf of Wall street.  Have you seen it?  the one iwht Leonardo DiCaprio and jonah Hill?
Not at all, but the title sounds familiar
When was the movie released?
2013,  its the american black comedy directed by martin scorsese and writen by terenca winter
I see, what was the movie cast like?
it was based on the memoir of Joredan Belfort and recounts his career as a strockbrocker in New York
They had a great cast, of course dicaprio and hill but aslo Margot Robbie who is gorgeous and Kyle Chandler and Rob Reiner.
Hmm
what reviews or ratings did the movie get across the several rating platforms?
It got overall good rating and good critic responses.  one even called it epic in size!
it averaged about a 7.8 across all
then it must be a great movie
can you just give a few details more, like whether there are action scenes you know.......

its just fascinated to watch what the late 80's where like in New York.  Htere is one scene wehre belfort procures a job as a sockbrocker and Mark Hanna, entices him with sex and drugs and teaches him that his only job is to make money for himself.  just to see the mentallity of the time is interesting.
or maybe what happened to belfort since it is more like his records

its definetly not an action packed movie.  its follows his life of getting a job as a broker and then finding his job terminated due to black monday and so he gets a job a a biler room brokerage form doing penny stockes
this explodes and he starts his own firm and makes a small fortune.
and I guess he rose to the top or ??
small fortune, from brokering? or drugs
oh he did, gets the big house, the fancy car, the trophy wife.  and even trains others on what he calls the "Hard Sell"
brokering.
he used the small small fortune to buy drugs though.
does the movie not have critics?
it does.
some claim it to be narrow in scope and that some of the characters are dull.
I see,
one critic does claim it to be an irresponsible glorification rather than a satirical takedown.  If you take movies to seriously then i guess i could see this.
but do you agree with that?
the characters being dull?
No, because i see it for what it is.  a cinematic interpretation of a mans life.  i dont think its intent is to glorify cheating others out of millions and obtaining wealth illegaly.
oh that part.
still no, I thought the characters where very believable and interesting.
Apart from Leonardo, do we have any other household name in the movie?
Jonah Hill
and now Margot Robbie is pretty well known.
especially after playing harlequin in Suicide Squad.
an would you really recommend the movie to a buddy like me?
Mathew Mcconaughey is in it too
*and
sure, its worth a watch. just be aware there are vulgar parts and adult themes.   dont take your kids
I see it has a good cast already
no problem dude, thanks for the heads up
catch you later
sure thing
c ya later.

uid2response.feedback: The user has a moderate narrative skill, I would definitely see the movie online before the week runs out
